This is a reference to the “hot” qualities of liquors; a sign of continued influence of humoral theory in eighteenth-century medical thought. Liquors were considered to be “hot” in nature, so for this man to refer to his Jamaican rum as “cold” in any way certainly indicates evidence of a drinking problem.
